questions.question: Is the white star with the number "4" visible on the turret of the tank?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the turret does not have a white star or the number '4'. The edited image shows a solid green color turret without any distinct markings that are visible in the original Image A.

questions.question: Are the markings "31 64A" and "A-14" visible on the lower sides of the tankâ€™s hull?
questions.explanation: In Image B, these markings are not present. The original Image A had these numbers clearly painted on the hull, but in the edited version, the hull has been altered, removing these details.

questions.question: Is the main gun barrel oriented straight forward from the turret?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the main gun barrel is distinctly oriented straight forward from the turret. The barrel's alignment suggests the same positioning as in Image A.

questions.question: Is the sign reading "FUTURE HOME OF THE NATIONAL ARMOR & CAVALRY MUSEUM" with the cavalry rider illustration and the website "www.armorcavalrymuseum.org" visible and legible?
questions.explanation: Image B does not contain the museum sign seen in Image A. The background in Image B has been replaced with a stylized green wall, eliminating any text or illustrations.

questions.question: Is there a tiger motif present on the front hull of the tank, located within the blue-and-white checkered area?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the tiger motif is clearly visible on the front hull, centered within a blue-and-white checkered area, identical to its depiction in Image A.

questions.question: Is the tank positioned to the left of the museum sign?
questions.explanation: The museum sign is absent in Image B; thus, comparisons regarding the tank's positioning relative to a sign cannot be made.

questions.question: Is the tank facing directly toward the camera (front-facing)?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the tank is positioned so that it is directly facing the camera, similar to Image A. The frontal view aligns symmetrically with the camera's perspective.

questions.question: Does the turret have a distinct cylindrical shape with a dome-like top and a single gun barrel protruding from the front?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the turret maintains a cylindrical shape with a dome-like top, and a single gun barrel protrudes from the front, consistent with typical tank turret designs and is similar to Image A.
